Yes I thought so. Ive run across a few who got started like that. Very few but its still interesting for me. 
   
  Misty

Guy <yzzzguy@...> wrote:
          To answer your question...yes. See Chapter 22.

http://www.worlditc.org/c_06_juerg_ch22.htm

Guy

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> Wow cool. I'm finding more and more I have in common with others. 
Didnt he also hear his mothers voice when he got started on this 
path? Same story here, thats the small voice.
> 
> Misty
> 
> Guy <yzzzguy@...> wrote:
> By the way - Friedrich Jurgenson wrote in his 
book "Voice 
> Transmissions With The Deceased" that he had a "spirit on the 
other 
> side" named Lena who would assist him with tuning his radio to the 
> proper frequency like you describe.
> 
> http://www.worlditc.org/c_06_juerg_ch13.htm
> 
> Guy
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@> wrote:
> ><snipped> 
> > For the sweep method I usually just tune until I hear my name 
> spoken "live" or they will say "right here" when you are in the 
> right tuning area. Recently Ive been trying the ST method first 
then 
> continue on into the water method. For some reason the voices are 
> very loud after the ST session ends and the radio is shut down. 
And 
> a few say they prefer the water over the radio for speech. Others 
> prefer the radio static. Not sure why exactly.
> > 
> > Misty
> 
> 
> 
>
